Description: Unidentified relief fragment: the relief, in opaque turquoise-blue glass, seems to be from the upper body of a human or divine figure represented frontally. It has the semi-circular opening for a necklace with the upper arms extended parallel to the floor. Only the upper torso is preserved. These resemblances are doubtless fortuitous. A frontal representation in glass would be most exceptional and it would be difficult to explain the position of the arms. The relief remains unidentified. The reverse has a heavy brown coating or adhesive.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 13 Oct-1998 5 Jan, India, New Delhi, National Museum, The Enduring Image 1998 9 Feb-3 May, India, Mumbai, Sir Caswasjee Jahangir Hall, The Enduring Image
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
